intro: Lasiosiphon meisnerianus var. spathulatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant has lanceolate to spatulate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
